title: What are the best lines to start a speech competition? - Quora

response.answer_text: This is my all time favourite question.. Well, I had written in one of the answers that a good speech should have a powerful start.. So let me give few examples…This may not be the best but impromptu this what comes to my mind now... :As I leaf through the pages of my childhood, I find few lines written about my crazy infatuation.... : Once upon a time there lived a man who was in his late 30s…every day he took the same route back home from his office.That evening was not the usual one... It was raining cats and dogs and the gentleman slowly drove down the lane enjoying the radio.Suddenly, he was stopped by three men covered from top to bottom... They pulled him out of his seat and rest what happened is history... The gentleman is now in his 40s and he is standing right in front of you..... These examples may not be the best as it came impromptu... Make the start with a pull Create suspense Pull your audience with your modulation and eye contact Keep unfolding the secrets slowly and with brilliance Never use fancy English and be very simple.. A good speaker always looks at simplicity .. I can go on and on

The opening statement/s attract the ATTENTION of the audience and draw them into your speech. So, an impressive or impactful opening line is ESSENTIAL for a good speech. It is even more important in a contest where you are being judged. Here are some tips you could use: Greet your audience with confidence and tinged with tonality that you feel would either:Impress themMake them like youI would suggest that you craft your opening statement (and your closing statement) in a way that they can be remembered by your audience. Words are important and how they are put together can make a huge difference to how the audience accepts you.Deliver it with IMPACT. Here you have to use your speaking abilities to advantage. Practise your opening lines many times. Enunciate it in different ways. Play with voice modulation. .. till you are convinced that you have your best 3 ways of delivering them. Then ask a few people (who you look up to)… to evaluate which is the best.Practise … practise… practise your best opening and closing lines till they are perfect.Of course… the body of the speech should flow well till you reach your conclusion… and surely … you will deliver this too… with the finesse and the power of a winner.All the very best!

Well!!! best ways to start a speech  Try to give the best quote related to the topic. Some quotes by great personality will work….. U can even start this way good morning to all…today in this fine morning I request you all to please lend me your ears…. As I had been provided a great opportunity to do so You could even ask audience to give their precious seconds for your lines Or you could address yourself as the receiver of golden opportunity to speak A short rhyme related to topic will work…for example, the topic is about women injustice you could start up this way “ Listen their cries, Listen their scream. Try to let them fulfill Their wishes and dream” You could even tell the reason that made you choose the topic. Take their attention towards the current status or issues related to your topic…..this attracts listeners… So try your level best. Have confidence, eye-contact and a powerful voice is must... Wherever necessary increase the volume to highlight…this ups and downs in voice's volume helps a lot And you are done….

Depending on the type of speech competition, the best lines to start your speech may vary. In my opinion, the below are a few of the best practices: Enter the stage with energy. Exit the stage with energy.No matter what your opening sentences are, say them with a lot of confidence.Own the stage.All the Best :) DawooD
